The Lord of the Rings Online

wikitext.*:
[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Buckland Gate.jpg|thumb|250px|The Buckland Gate in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
The '''Buckland Gate''',<ref name=VI7>{{RK|Homeward}}, p. 996</ref> '''Hay Gate''',<ref name=VI8>{{RK|Scouring}}, p. 998</ref> or the '''North- gate''',<ref name=Conspiracy>{{FR|Conspiracy}}, p. 107</ref><ref>{{FR|Knife}}, p. 177</ref> were names for a gate at the northern end of the hedge<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''North-gate'', p. 118</ref> known as the [[High Hay]].<ref>{{FR|Conspiracy}}, p. 99</ref>

Leaving [[the Shire]] across the [[Brandywine Bridge]], a traveler would come to the northern end of the High Hay, where it ran down to the bank of the River [[Brandywine]] just on the eastern side of the Brandywine Bridge south of the [[East Road]]. In the Hedge at this point was a guarded gate that led to [[Buckland]], the Eastmarch of the Shire.<ref name=Conspiracy/>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2007: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:The Buckland Gate is just to the south-east of the [[Brandywine Bridge]] and leads into [[Newbury]] beyond.
